name: UPBBridge
0:
”Alexa, turn on kitchen light”
”Alexa, dim living room light”
”Alexa, turn on dinner time”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
The Voice UPB Bridge skill is the interface to the UPB Voice Bridge installed in your home. Using this skill, you can control lights and appliances as well as activate and deactivate lighting scenes.

The UPB Voice Bridge allows access to all UPB gear available from any of the licensed manufacturers of UPB. This includes PulseWorx, Simply Automated, and Web Mountain Technologies.

The easy-to-use configuration program provided with your Bridge installation, can load your network definition file or scan your installation to locate your devices. Then you can select those devices you want to control directly. The name you use with Alexa can be different than the room and device name saved in the memory of each device and can be updated at any time.

While direct control is appropriate for some devices, the power and utility of a UPB installation is better handled with scene control. In your home when you press “this” button on “that” keypad a scene is activated or deactivated. The Bridge configuration program lets you see your keypads, buttons, switch rockers – any inputs to your installation – and name them so Alexa, when they are controlled ON or OFF, performs the same actions as if you pressed “this” button or tapped “that” switch rocker.

The devices and scenes selected for control, and the names spoken to Alexa for them, can be changed at any time using the configuration program.

Prerequisites:
The Voice UPB Bridge requires that the Bridge hardware be installed and running 24/7 in your home. Complete instructions for installation and configuration are available on the VoiceUPBBridge.com web site in the documentation area.
